COMMENT_TX: Rollins hurt leg while warming up - onto DL

ej,riggj801,M,schrp901,Balls and strikes $Nationals manager Jim Riggleman went to the mound to talk with Jason Marquis; when HP umpire Paul Schreiber went to the mound to speed up the talk, Riggleman discussed Schreiber's strike zone and was ejected by Schreiber
Phillies right fielder Jayson Werth left the game due to an injured hip
fan interference

replay,1,utlec001,PHI,mcclt901,PHI13,F,N,I,,H $Chase Utley hit the 3-2 pitch down the RF line; it curved past the pole on the foul side and was called a foul ball by 1B umpire Adrian Johnson; Phillies manager Charlie Manuel asked Johnson about the call, the umpires conferred and then crew chief Tim McClelland watched the replay and upheld the call

ej,manuc101,M,fleta901,Interference call $the Cardinals successfully execute the rotation play covering the bunt with SS Brendam Ryan covering 3B on the force; HP umpire Andy Fletcher called batter Joe Blanton out for running inside line and interfering with 2B Skip Schumaker's ability to catch the throw at 1B; Phillies manager Charlie Manuel argued the call with plate umpire Fletcher, who eventually ejected Manuel
Phillies shortstop Juan Castro left the game due to an injured leg
Debut game for Craig Kimbrel
Phillies catcher Brian Schneider left the game due to an injured Achilles tendon in his left heel
Cubs pitcher Tom Gorzelanny left because single by Ruiz was line drive off his pitching hand. Not broken
Phillies shortstop Jimmy Rollins left the game due to an injured leg
Padres right fielder Will Venable left the game due to an injured neck
Debut game for Mike Stanton
$kubel's bat broke and hit catcher Ruiz in the back of the helmet. He did not lose consciousness, but left game and went to hospital
$the 505th home run allowed by Jamie Moyer to tie the career record set by Robin Roberts

ej,manuc101,M,holbs901,Interference call $Jason Donald made a great diving stop on the ball hit by Shane Victorino; Donald tossed to SS Anderson Hernandez, who relayed the ball to 1B; Victorino beat the play at 1B and a run scored; Raul Ibanez slid about four feet to the right of 2B trying to slow Hernandez as he made the play to 1B and 2B umpire Sam Holbrook called Ibanez for runner interference; thus Victorino was out to end the inning and the run did not count; Phillies manager Charlie Manuel argued the call with Holbrook, who ejected Manuel
Phillies pitcher Chad Durbin pulled a hamstring badly while fielding the bunt

ej,manuc101,M,gibsg901,Call at 1B on Victorino leaving the baseline $Shane Victorino hit a bouncer down the 1B line that was fielded by pitcher Fausto Carmona; Carmona then reached out to tag Victorino but the latter ran around him to avoid the tag and dove to the bag; Victorino was called out for leaving the baseline by 1B umpire Greg Gibson; Phillies manager Charlie Manuel argued with Gibson for a while and eventually stuck his finger up in front of Gibson's face; Manuel was ejected by Gibson
1:37 rain delay during which the high winds pulled the tarp off the infield

$hard grounder off Votto's glove into foul ground; he recovered and threw to Cueto covering 1B and Victorino collided with him, knocking off his glove; the ball bounced into foul territory and was retrieved by Votto as Victorino turned toward second; Votto threw to Cueto again, but he had no glove and ball hit him in the groin, bouncing loose again; Votto retrieved the ball, pushing Cueto away as he did and threw too late to get Rollins at home. He had been running on the pitch; Cueto was hurt when Victorino stepped on his foot at 1B; Cueto pulled his foot out from under Victorino's when he went to chase the ball the second time.
$runner scored from second because pitcher and catcher both chased after the wild pitch and no one covered home

replay,3,ruizc001,PHI,hirsj901,PHI13,I,N,I,,H $a fan reached over the fence at the 387 marker in left-center attempting to catch the ball; it caromed back onto the field and was called fan interference by 2B umpire Laz Diaz; crew chief John Hirschbeck watched the replay and upheld the call

replay,4,wertj001,PHI,hirsj901,PHI13,I,N,I,,H $a fan reached over the top of the wall with a glove to catch the ball in the triangle area near the 409 marker; it was ruled fan interference but crew chief John Hirschbeck watched the replay and upheld the call

$Belisario faked to third and then to first, but there was no runner on third! The umpires did not call it immediately and the Phillies objected; after the umpires huddled, they called the balk

ej,bochb002,M,carlm901,Balk call $Giants pitcher Ramon Ramirez started his motion after being in the set position; it was not clear whether his front leg moved toward third or home but then he turned and threw to first, picking off Jimmy Rollins; HP umpire Mark Carlson immediately called a balk on Ramirez; Giants Manager Bruce Bochy came out and asked about the balk and then argued enough that he was ejected by Carlson
Desmond was far off base when ball was caught, overslid the base as he tried to get back and was tagged by a lunging Chase Utley
Nationals pitcher Stephen Strasburg left the game due to an injured right elbow
$Roger Bernadina called for interference for running into his own bunt
$rain delay of 1:44
$this pickoff was a continuation of the IW

ej,manuc101,M,gibsg901,Call at 1B $Michael Bourn ran a little out of the line in foul territory to avoid the diving tag by Phillies first baseman Ryan Howard; Phillies Manager Charlie Manuel argued that Bourn was out of the base line and should be called out and was ejected by 1B umpire Greg Gibson

ej,howar001,P,barrs901,Checked swing ej,gloar001,P,gibsg901,Bench jockeying while on DL $3B umpire Scott Barry ruled that Phillies Ryan Howard did not check his swing for the second strike; Howard glared at Barry, who put his hands on his hips and glared back; the third strike was another check swing that Barry also ruled as a swing; Howard threw his bat and yelled at Barry and was ejected by Barry as he tossed his helmet away; Howard then charged toward Barry while HP umpire Greg Gibson tried to stop him; Howard told Gibson 'Don't you talk to me' as he moved down the 3B line; he had to be restrained by teammates and 2B umpire Sam Holbrook; Ross Gload was yelling from the bench; he was on the DL and not allowed to interact as he was doing, so he was ejected by Gibson
$the Phillies were out of position players, so pitcher Roy Oswalt was put in left field and left fielder Raul Ibanez moved to first base
$Raul Ibanez dove and tagged the bag to get the out on the bunt

$the third pitch to Shane Victorino hit his left arm; HP umpire Brian Knight ruled that Victorino did not make an effort to avoid the pitch; Phillies manager Charlie Manuel argued the ruling and the umpires huddled on the infield; the call stood

$Humberto Quintero blocked the pitch and the ball landed in front of the plate; Ben Francisco stood off the bag at third; Quintero picked up the ball and looked at Francisco then threw to Chris Johnson; Francisco moved back to the bag but missed it and stepped on Johnson's foot before getting on the bag; Johnson tagged Francisco before the latter touched the bag

$with 2 strikes and Lidge ready to pitch, Mets manager Manuel called time out as batter grounded back to pitcher for apparent end of game. He inserted pinch-runner to distract Lidge who then completed strikeout
